content.description: Good warm up for billy blues.
content.location: At the tallest part of the area.

content.description: This is an elimination climb! Left hand start is the pinch at midsection height. Right hand start is the triangular undercling. Other holds are limited to the monopocket to the right at about 6.5 feet, the flat crimp to the left about 8 feet, the first large rhino horn jug, and the second large rhino horn jug. Top out as you wish after that. Beta video: youtube.com/watch?v=MMD5mhQ…

Not as polished as the rest of the wall.  Sit start at a sidepull at the wide horizontal split and go one of two options:

 Left (blue):  follow the inside corner crack to the top.  Committing.

 Right (yellow): up the face with right hand arete.  Crux: big reach to the lip 3/4 of the way up
content.protection: Landing isn’t great, spotter and 3-4 pads
content.location: Far right side of the wall.

content.description: Current grade is temporary - actual grade is around 7b-7c+. No known FA. Left hand start is a good pinch and right hand start is a slopey quarter pad crimp. Use the upside down triangular divot and quarter pad side pull on the left to get to the 2 finger crimp on the right. The 6th hold is meaty pinch and 7th is a solid large crimp (hard to see from pic). Top out has good holds.
content.location: The route is at the tallest part of the boulder.

content.description: At least a dozen good problems, the traverse is exceptional; secluded in the woods.
